Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui.controllers

Class CharactersController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui.controllers.PageController
it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui.controllers.CharactersController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CharactersController extends PageController implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is used to manage the character's Scene.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • setCharacterCards

      public void setCharacterCards(CharacterCardData[] characterCards)
      This method is called when a game starts or is reopened. It sets the images of the character cards available and their description
      Parameters:
      characterCards - the CharacterCardData of the 3 avaible characterCards

    • selectCharacter

      public void selectCharacter(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is called when a character card is clicked on. It shows the description of the CharacterCard and the button to activate it. It disables and renders not visible all of the other CharacterCards
      See Also:
      • MouseEvent

    • activate

      public void activate(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      When an "Activate" button is clicked this method is called. It sends an ActivateCharacterCardMessage to ServerHandler
      See Also:
      • ActivateCharacterCardMessage
      • ActionEvent

    • back

      public void back(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is associated to the "Go to Gameboard" button. It changes the currScene in GUI to gameBoard.fxml
      See Also:
      • ActionEvent

    • updateCharacterCard

      public void updateCharacterCard(CharacterCardData characterCardData)
      Updates the pieces and the cost related to the character cards
      Parameters:
      characterCardData - the information that needs to be updated
      See Also:
      • CharacterCardData

    • setActivatedCharacter

      public void setActivatedCharacter(CharacterID activatedCharacter, String nicknameCurrPlayer, boolean puntualEffectApplied)
      It sets the style of the Anchor corresponding to the activated character. If a character is activated it will highlight the corresponding anchor pane.
      Parameters:
      activatedCharacter - the character card that has been activated. If the punctual effect has not been applied the client can be redirected to certain scenes according to the character that has been activated.
      nicknameCurrPlayer - the nickname of the player that has activated the card
      puntualEffectApplied - if the punctual effect has been applied.

    • setNickname

      public void setNickname(String nickname)

    • applyEffect

      public void applyEffect()
      This method is used for the PRINCESS and the MONK characters. For the Princess it sends fire to the ServerHandler that a student has been chosen. For the Monk it redirects the client to the Islands page so that an island can be selected using setCharacterMap().
      See Also:
      • ApplyCharacterCardEffectMessage2
